title: Patiently Navigating the Waiting Periods

content: Several periods come to mind when I think of the times my patience was tested most throughout my diagnosis.

The first was after I completed my biopsy and had to wait 3 days for the call informing me that I had breast cancer. From then on, waiting became part of my routine. I awaited the scan results that would determine whether the cancer had spread. After completing chemotherapy and surgery, I then awaited another call, this time declaring that there was no evidence of disease.

Following my subsequent diagnosis last year, I found myself in a similar position, awaiting news about what type of cancer I was facing and whether further treatment would be necessary. I’m grateful that the tumor was localized and that I didn’t need to repeat chemotherapy. However, I had to start the reconstruction process all over again on my left breast, which required nine tissue expansion appointments over 4 months. After completing these appointments, I then waited another 7 months for my implant-exchange surgery.

content: Recently, I found myself in yet another period of waiting. Following my implant-exchange surgery, I was due for my first set of scans since receiving my sarcoma diagnosis last year. The tissue expander I had in place before contained metal, making it unsafe to do an MRI until it was removed.

I’d be lying if I said I wasn’t a little nervous while waiting for the scan results. As much as I try to be proactive about my health, there’s only so much I can know from an outside perspective. Although I pray and believe that all is well internally, it's nerve-wracking not knowing what’s actually going on inside my body. Thankfully, my scans came back clear.

In life, there will always be periods of waiting and uncertainty. These are usually the times when fear, doubt, and anxiety try to creep into my life the most. My faith helps me through such periods, reminding me that God is always in control. Here are a few scriptures and affirmations that help keep me grounded during these times:
bullets: “Do not be anxious about anything, but in everything, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God. And the peace of God, which transcends all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.” – Philippians 4:6-7
“For I know the plans I have for you,” declares the Lord, “plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.” – Jeremiah 29:11
“I focus on what I can control and let go of the rest.”
“I cultivate patience and positivity, knowing that my words shape my reality.”

content: As I reflect on the many moments of waiting – waiting for test results, for surgeries, for healing – I’m reminded that each pause in life holds a purpose. These periods have challenged me to slow down, to listen to my body, and to embrace the support of those around me. They’ve also deepened my faith, reminding me that while I may not always understand the timing, there’s a plan greater than my own at work.

I’ve learned that patience isn’t passive; it’s a quiet yet powerful form of resilience, requiring us to hold onto hope even when we can’t see the outcome. It’s about being kind to ourselves as we navigate the unknown and trusting that, in time, clarity will come.

To anyone who finds themselves in a season of waiting, know that you’re not alone. Embrace the journey, lean into your faith, and remember that each day brings you one step closer to where you’re meant to be.
